items.item_details: EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICTTO:Board of TrusteesFROM:Bob NuĂąezPREPARED BY:Dan Moser, Associate Superintendent of Instruction and Human RelationsSUBJECT:Accept the Second Valenzuela/CAHSEE and Williams Settlement Uniform Complaints Quarterly Report for Period Covering April 1 -  June 30, 2008 as required by EC 35186 (Williams Settlement Legislation SB550 The Board of Trustees revised BP 1312 (Uniform Complaint Procedures) through the adoption of a BP 1312.1(a) Supplement and accompanying regulations.  This “supplement” section to BP 1312 incorporates the recent requirements of EC 35186 (Williams: SB550 and AB2727), which requires a different complaint form and timeline.  Additionally, it is required that staff bring to the Board of Trustees a quarterly report of Williams complaints filed and their current disposition.  The attached report indicates the number of complaints filed from April 1, 2008 through June 30, 2008.FISCAL IMPACT:NoneFUNDING SOURCE:Senate Bill 6 (Williams)State Instructional Materials AllocationDistrict Instructional Materials BudgetOther Categorical funds as AppropriateRECOMMENDATION:The administration recommends that the Governing Board accept the Second QuarterlyValenzuela/CAHSEEand Williams Settlement Uniform Complaint report for the period covering April 1, 2008 through June 30, 2008,as required by EC 35186 (Williams Settlement Legislation SB550 and AB2727).

items.item_details: EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICTTO:	Board of TrusteesFROM:	Bob Nuñez, Superintendent PREPARED BY:	Alan Garofalo, Associate Superintendent of Student Services and Facilities SUBJECT:	APPROVE HOURLY PAY INCREASE FOR CAMPUS POLICE OFFICERS, CAMPUS POLICE COORDINATORS AND DISTRICT POLICE COORDINATOR The District is having difficulty finding qualified San Jose Police Department Officers to work as Campus Police Officers and Campus Police Coordinators.  The primary reason for this difficulty is that the District is not competitive in our hourly rate of pay.  The District pays $43.00 per hour for officers while the current rate of pay for San Jose Police Department is $44.00 per hour. The District also currently pays the coordinators $50.00 per hour. An increase of Campus Police Officers hourly rate to $44.00 per hour and $51.00 per hour for the Coordinators would allow the District to remain competitive with neighboring districts. The rate of pay for the District Police Coordinator is at the recommended rate of $54.00 per hour.FISCAL IMPACT:$70,000.00FUNDING SOURCE:General Fund and School Safety and Violence Prevention Act (SSVPA) FundsRECOMMENDATION:It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the increase in Campus Police Officers, Campus Police Coordinators and District Police Coordinator hourly pay rate.
items.item_text: Approve Hourly Pay Increase for Campus Police Officers, Campus Police Coordinators and District Police Coordinator – Alan Garofalo, Associate Superintendent of Student Services and Facilities
items.item_text_raw: 8.07 Approve Hourly Pay Increase for Campus Police Officers, Campus Police Coordinators and District Police Coordinator – Alan Garofalo, Associate Superintendent of Student Services and Facilities

items.item_details: EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICTTO:Board of TrusteesFROM:Bob NuĂąez, SuperintendentPREPARED BY:Dan Moser, Associate Superintendent of Instruction and Human RelationsSUBJECT:Approve Job Description and Salary for Coordinator of Child Development ProgramRequest the approval of the attached job description and salary for the position of Coordinator of Child Development Program.The job description for the Coordinator of the Child Development Program was last revised in September 1991.  Since that time, the program has evolved, the funding sources and regulations have changed, and the level of supervision has increased. The attached description addresses these issues.This position is a 12-month Certificated Management position.  Salary is per the appropriate placement on the Classified and Certificated Management Salary Schedule.FISCAL IMPACT:$74,560 / year - $107,941 / yearFUNDING SOURCE:Catergorical FundsRECOMMENDATION:It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the Job Description and Salary for the Coordinator of Child Development Program.

Our adopted rules of Parliamentary Procedure, Robert's Rules, provide for a consent agenda listing several items for approval of the Board by a single motion.  Most of the items listed under the consent agenda have gone through Board subcommittee review and recommendation.  Documentation concerning these items has been provided to all Board members and the public in advance to assure an extensive and thorough review.  Items may be removed from the consent agenda at the request of any board member.
